programme.title: Im Alive
programme.desc: In a lion reserve owned by a family friend, teenager Dane Keiser falls prey to three huge lions.

programme.desc: Brett and Wayde ambush unsuspecting aquarium owners in desperate need of a tank makeover. Working together they make the aquarium more beautiful and easier to maintain.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr Blue makes an impulse purchase of an aquarium without discussing the idea with Jessica, while Dr Lavigne performs knee surgery on a bulldog.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: One-year old chihuahua Zorro shocks Dr Lavigne with a serious heart condition for such a young dog. Dr Ross treats six sugar gliders.

programme.title: Toucan Nation
programme.desc: Documentary about an animal refuge in Costa Rica that took in a mutilated toucan and gave it a second chance by making it a prosthetic beak with the help of a 3D printer.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson enters Ellen’s world, one that’s crawling with neighborhood feral cats, who she’s been feeding and trying to contain virtually by herself for 20 years; a pair of hairless Donskoy cats who are treating their guardians home like it’s a party zone.

programme.title: Crikey! Its The Irwins: Bindis Wedding
programme.desc: Bindi and Chandler prepare for the happiest day of their lives. However, weeks before the big day, the coronavirus pandemic causes them to make drastic changes to their plans.

programme.title: Gamechangers: Inventing The World
programme.desc: Two pioneers in electric power both aim to develop technologies that reduce carbon emissions - both using electric motors and batteries in aviation and speedboats.

programme.title: My Tiny Terror

programme.title: The Vet Life

programme.desc: Dr. Blue has a crisis to deal with when a dog comes in that has chewed off her own tail. Plus, Dr. Ross has to make a big decision regarding an amputation.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr. Blue investigates why a dog is so lethargic - did he eat his owners shorts? Plus, Dr. Lavigne operates on a husky and Dr. Ross pet needs treatment!

programme.title: Lone Star Law

programme.desc: The NTS crew travels to an alpaca farm to build a lodge in the trees inspired by our National Parks. They create a structure to take in the mountain views with a 50 ft long cable bridge entrance and a deck devoted entirely to hammock lounging.

programme.desc: What happens when a zebra has no stripes and why goats would risk their lives to climb an almost vertical wall.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: A couple is torn between two dogs and cant decide who to bring home with them. And, a local stray is in dire need of medical attention, but afraid of humans.

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?

programme.desc: Lamput spends the day at the beach, and, in a pair of swimming trunks, cuts a fine figure indeed. That is to say; a small, round and blobby figure. It only takes one snide comment from a fellow beach-goer to bring Lamputs body issues to the surface. When youre a shape changer, though, theres no need for exercise; before long Lamput is strutting along as an orange amalgam of all the best-looking sunbakers. On the up side, its a handy disguise when the Docs come a-hunting. On the down side? Well, its kind of tiring pretending to be someone youre not. Lamput learns an important lesson from a nearby blobby little girl. Be yourself, and if anyones got a problem with that, they can go find their own patch of sand.

When the thunder from the storms around Venus scare Buttons into accidentally detaching himself from his pod, he lands on the pla net and disappears. Ella and her friends search frantically on the hot planet but cannot find him. It’s Buttons who finds Ella! programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and her friends play a star-riddle game that is a tradition in Slippy’s family. In order to beat Slippy’s cousins, they need to find some super-giant stars!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy’s cousin Gem wants time apart from her twin brother I.Lo, but he doesn’t want to hear it. When no one wants to investigate the super puff planet they discovered, Gem races off on her own, despite the high temperatures and strong winds.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: The weasels steal Ratty’s rowing boat but soon find themselves in trouble on a fast flowing river.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Mole struggles to get everyone to embrace his newfound love for forest bathing, he tries to be more like Toad. But the newly confident Mole soon clashes with Toads forceful personality. Can either learn something from the other?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Mole is having a clear-out and gives Toad Mr. Tiddles, his old teddy bear. Once its gone, he has second thoughts. But the weasels kidnap Mr. Tiddles, and Mole and Toad have to mount a daring rescue mission to get dear Mr. Tiddles back.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Adder sets one riverbanker against the other in order to seize all of Mole’s toffee apple pie but they soon realise she is up to one of her tricks again.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad decides to actually ride his horse Mulberry as both his car and caravan are out of action. But riding a horse requires skills Toad simply hasn’t got.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: During a visit to Buckingham Palace Mr Bean meets the lady of the house.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket the mean landlady never makes life easy, but Beans always got a plan or two up his sleeve.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean finds himself lumbered with an unwanted pet in the form of a four-legged ball of pink fur with piggy eyes and a penchant for earthworms.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: When invited to dinner by Mr Bean it’s probably best to take your own sandwiches.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella feels terrible when she accidentally ruins some of her mother’s old photographs. She convinces her family to recreate the scenes in the old pictures into new ones! But things don’t go quite as planned -- a lot has changed in space over the years.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and the gang are going camping! But as they approach their camp site, Maggie alerts them that a giant solar flare is heading their way. They must turn off all their electronics until the storm subsides.

programme.title: Diesel Brothers
programme.desc: Redbeard takes on a diesel build of his own. Will his Hail Mary cost them a Queens Ransom? Meanwhile, its time to see if the Gama Goat will sink or swim.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys are in Maine to help a couple whose homestead is overrun with boglands. They build structures to help with the brutal winters.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike buys a supercar from the super saver menu, specifically an Italian thoroughbred for under £10,000. But with supercars come super-sized bills.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Paul and Drew head to Kent to look at a glamorous Sunbeam Alpine roadster. With the classic car in demand, Paul is sure its a smart buy, but Drew needs some convincing.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike finds a 56-year-old Citroen 2CV, retired in the sunny south of France. However, with age comes problems - can Edd fire life into the smoky old engine?

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike is in Idaho to buy the ultimate retro sportster, the Karmann Ghia. Edd loves it, but will the broken gearbox and shoddy interior stop them making a profit?

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Examines the various processes which are used to make items such as Thai barbecues, diving masks and fins, and bassoons.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they forge super steel to make a car lighter, greener and safer? And, how do they shear Australias eighty million sheep every Spring?

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew bargains hard in Frome, Somerset; in Dumfriesshire, Drew is at an estate that has been in the same family for several generations.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers save a quirky counter, a 100-piece chandelier and a vintage football table. Plus, a 100-year-old shop counter is rescued from a bonfire.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunters
programme.desc: Firefighter Nicki wants to simplify her life by downsizing from her house to a smaller home. She seeks a place a fraction of the size of her current abode.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunters
programme.desc: A travelling nurse is looking for a tiny home that can move with her on her various job assignments across the country.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer lands a Ford Escort Mk1 for £4,500 in an internet auction, and he and Edd China get to work on giving the classic 1970s car a new lease of life with a retro refit.

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: The fabrication for Kevin Harts Challenger is complete, and now Dave is taking his futuristic theme into the dash and interior. A new custom color, flawless body work and seamless assembly are in store for this client who expects perfection.

programme.title: Twin Turbos

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: From the icy docks of Bristol to the tropical paradise of the Caribbean, follow the incredible journey of fearsome buccaneers and their hunt for treasure and booty.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: Every year thousands of objects both natural and man-made plummet through our atmosphere and crash into the Earth. These menacing messengers from the sky provide scientists with amazing insights into the phenomena of the cosmos.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: What compelled ancient man to move colossal stones to build remarkably similar stone monuments all around the world, from the jungles of Costa Rica to England’s countryside?

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: Inspired by the divine, we create monuments to its power (Stonehenge, the Great Pyramid). New challenges create new sciences, and when the Romans mixed volcanic ash with water they created a new super-material: concrete.

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: No prizes for second place! In this episode we learn how being the fastest enabled empires to be born and capitalism to thrive.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Inflicting over $80 billion in damage, and causing the deaths of over 1800 people, Hurricane Katrina was among the greatest engineering disasters in US history.

programme.title: Gold Hunters: Legend Of The Superstition Mountains
programme.desc: Hunting for the Lost Dutchman is usually a one-man journey, but Wayne Tuttle is partnering with a team of experts to follow a newly-revealed clue that could finally solve the 500-year-old mystery of Americas most famous buried treasure.

programme.title: Gold Hunters: Legend Of The Superstition Mountains
programme.desc: Closer than ever to the $200 million payday, Wayne and the team head into the heart of darkness where a cryptic find weaves an even bigger mystery.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: Large cats are prowling parts of America and they may have a taste for flesh. Witnesses in New York State say they are seeing big black cats. However, only jaguars and leopards appear black and neither is native to the eastern United States.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: In the opening episode, the pair tackle the River Forth in the shadow of Stirling Castle. In the first archaeological river search of this spot, they set out on the hunt for relics of Scotlands greatest medieval warriors, William Wallace and Robert the Bruce, revealing secrets from the battle sites of their most famous victories against their hated English overlords.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: There have been stories for centuries about huge, aggressive albino sperm whales. They were immortalised by the novel "Moby Dick." These stories told of whales targeting ships and ramming them with their huge heads. Could stories like this be true?

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: The Wild West was full of gambling, frenzied gold rushes and legendary racketeers. It was a lawless age when people wanted two things: money and a good time.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: On alien planets, they rain from the sky as scalding iron. Theyre so rare in the Universe, they almost dont exist, but these are the magical liquids of our Liquid Universe.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The gods worshipped by the Norse Vikings were fearsome and mysterious. Experts investigate whether these powerful Viking Gods could have been visitors from another planet.

programme.title: Search For The Lost Giants
programme.desc: The Viera brothers travel to the Ozarks and make two possibly game-changing discoveries.

programme.title: Chasing Mummies
programme.desc: Zahi wants to see if the long-forgotten Falcon Galleries can be restored as a new tourist destination. Inside, not only are there thousands of mummified birds, but deadly snakes and scorpions, too!

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: Terry Schappert reveals why the Vikings were called the "Hells Angels of the Middle Ages". He tests the weapons and tactics used to pillage Europe. They pillage Europe, but they meet their match--the Saxons--at the Battle of Maldon.

programme.desc: A set of replica Muppets has Chum green with envy; Will going gonzo over these furry friends land him the goods? When a pair of pants supposedly worn by Keith Richards rolls into the shop, Corey teaches Jake you cant always get what you want.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers Little Field Mouse has a wonderful collection of interesting Autumn leaves and Little Grey Squirrel has a collection of acorns of all varieties, he decides to start a collection of his own. But Little Nutbrown Hare cant decide what to collect, until his father encourages him to realise that he has a wonderful collection of memories.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse are surprised to find an egg lying on the ground. Blue Bird agrees to look after it and when a rather odd and demanding bird hatches, she loves it like her own. When Little White Owl hears it calling one night, she tells them all that the ‘lucky chick’ is a baby owl and she will teach her all an owl needs to know.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Apricot doesn’t like loud noises and gets really scared during a thunderstorm. Which objects make a loud noise and which objects are quiet?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and his pals all receive party invitations, but the partys location is a mystery. Small circular marks left behind by whoever delivered the invitations are an important clue. It leads Huckle and pals to Miss Honey whos been walking with a crutch. Grateful for the help she got raking up all her leaves, Miss Honey decided to throw a party for all the volunteers./Huckle and his pals discover a mysterious gigantic spoon.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is fascinated by a goldfish swimming around in its bowl. “How do you stay under water for so long” he asks but there’s no response from the fish apart from a line of bubbles, which Messy watches rise to the surface. “When you need to know go to Okido” he cries. In Okido, Messy joins Zoe and Felix in the garden where they’re looking at all their favourite finds gathered in a treasure chest. Messy’s attention immediately turns to a golden-shiny-round-thing that glistens golden in the sunlight.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy is about to have his favourite snack – a pair of socks! He quickly gulps down the first delicious sock and then reaches out for the second but he can’t find it. “It’s got to be here somewhere, but why can’t I see it?” He says. A puzzled Messy transports himself to Okido to find out. Messy lands in Okido and startles at the sight of a ginormous multi-coloured paper model monster. “We made it for you” giggle Zoe and Felix as they appear from behind their hiding places.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When Apple feels left out of a Berryball game and an advanced ballet class, she invents some “groove booties” programmed to dance to any beat. She temporarily impresses her friends with her dance moves, but when the groove booties go out of control and threaten the towns Berryball game, she is forced to fess up.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Sam uses Harrys bucket to collect drips from a leak in the house Harry rushes to Dino-World to save the dinos from drowning.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: At his schools Show and Tell, Harrys dinosaurs are branded as old-fashioned in comparison to one of the other kids hi-tech Dino-Robot.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo meets an oriental pied hornbill while picking apples in his garden. To find the hornbill’s nest, the Junior Rangers set out for the rainforest once again.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In Brazil, Thomas meets two wood-burning engines whove never travelled beyond their eucalyptus railway. Thomas agrees to swap jobs with them for the day, but this causes more trouble than he expects.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When a pretend emergency quickly becomes a real one, its up to Emily to think on her wheels and solve a big problem.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Doctor Natureza needs help to clean up the ocean. Indeed, a large sheet of plastic floats on the water and endangers the flora and fauna. Grisu, accompanied by Stella, boards the « laboratory boat » to help Doctor Natureza vacuum up the waste with the machine she has developed. But throughout the process, Grisu burns the pumping engine. They cant vacuum the ocean anymore. Fortunately, Grisu has the idea of using all the waste that lies around them and Naturezas bicycle to design a new – and ecological- device that finally allows them to achieve the mission. Because, as firefighter, Grisu never gives up!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Mr. Cornuzzo, a journalist, comes to Dragontown to check whether Stella’s school blog articles about Grisu are true. He quickly comes to the conclusion that what Stella invented everything, and she is actually a liar. To his eyes, Grisù is nothing more than a tiny lizard!Driven by his friendship for Stella, Grisu tries to do his best to prove Cornuzzo that there are dragons in Dragontown. However, acting like a dragon is none of Grisù’s best skills.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Summer’s day Little Field Mouse is very excited to show Little Nutbrown Hare her new favourite thing, a very pretty flower… the prettiest ever! She lets Little Nutbrown Hare borrow it to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but when it blows away during the night Little Nutbrown Hare worries how his friend will react. Will he be able to work up the courage to tell her what happened?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Trying to keep cool on a sticky Summer’s day by the stream, Little Nutbrown Hare and Big Nutbrown Hare have lots of fun skipping stones and throwing sticks. When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that sticks float, the two follow the sticks down the river to see where they go. It’s not an easy chase, and there is a surprise around every corner. Where will the sticks end up?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: While playing in the boys room, Woodsy and Rosie damage Scoutbadgers cuddly toy. They decide not to tell him and take the cuddly toy to their hide-out to try and fix it! But the repairs go wrong, and the cuddly toy ends up looking less and less like a cuddly toy! Rosie and Woodsy decide to abandon the toy in theforest rather than tell the truth... But when they change their minds, the toy has been taken by an ugly crow!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are building a new aquarium at the sea life center for a baby tiger shark. Scoop is excited, imagining the shark will be like a pet puppy. Leo is less than enthused, barely concealing his fear of sharks. When the shark is collected at the docks and placed in a holding tank inside Muck’s tray, Scoop convinces Muck they should take “Stripy” the shark “for a walk” around the neighbourhood. After introducing her to Pilchard, and pointing out the mayor’s office (startling Mr Bentley!), they see JJ and Saffi on the playing field, teaching Cooper some pet tricks. Determined to teach Stripy some tricks too, Scoop and Muck begin a game of fetch... which ends up with Muck getting his front bucket stuck between two trees. Back at the sea life centre, Bob is concerned. If the shark doesn’t arrive soon, she will miss her feeding time.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the gang are building an Automatic Car Wash for Curtis’s Garage, but Roley is being as obsessive as ever, checking and re-checking that the newly laid tarmac is absolutely, completely flat. Just as Roley gives Bob the all clear to start building, Mayor Madison and Mr. Bentley arrive in Phillip expecting to use the car wash! Wendy explains they’ve been held up – but to come back later. Once the car wash is ready, Wendy explains how the control console works and does a ‘test run’. It works perfectly and at last Curtis can re-open his garage. Roley, however, is still not convinced the tarmac is flat. To re-assure him Bob tells Leo to do one more test run. As the run starts, Roley thinks he sees some un-flattened tarmac and rushes into the car wash to flatten it!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Mr. Rabbit makes up coupons for free cookies to celebrate the grand opening of his cookie shop and gives them to his young son to drop in the mailbox outside. But the coupons never arrive. After chasing down the clues from the mail carrier to the post office and back again, Huckle determines that Jr Rabbit mistakenly dropped the coupons into the trash container beside the mail box. /A model boat is mysteriously broken and Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to discover how it happened.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari was practicing her recording skill, imitating the bird sounds as she relaxing in the forest. Suddenly, she hears some whistles, squeals and clicks from a far. She investigates the sound through the bushes and come across a Mother Tapir and its baby. Zari never seen these anything like this before so she try approaching the animals. All of the sudden, a leopard appears and targets the mother Tapir. Zari wants to help so she blows her recorder to scare the animal off. Her plan works but it also causes the baby Tapir to run away on another direction than its mother. Zari felt worried for the baby Tapir and calls on the Junior Ranger. In the garden, Leo And Katie are deciding which 2 types of carpets to put in their treehouse. They were discussing on which carpet pattern is more good. They cant decide and let Hero to help them pick an answer. Suddenly, they get interrupt by Zari whos asking them to help with the poor lost baby Tapir. After learning the information from Zaris picture and learn its a Malayan Tapir, the Junior Rangers grab their backpack and head out to help Zari. The Junior Rangers rode PlatypusOne and arrive in the forest. There, they meet up with Zari and the mother Malayan Tapir. The mother Malayan Tapir was sad and begin to make whistling and clicking noise to reach to her baby. Zari told the Junior Rangers those were the sound that she heard earlier. Zari then spots a brown furry spotted animal from a far and tell them to see if its the baby Tapir theyre searching for. Eventually it is reveal to be a Malayan mouse deer.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle was lounging on the beach, stargazing with his toy kangaroo Stella as he admiring the peaceful moment. Then he was interrupted by a fallen coconut. Startled by the sound, Kyle grab his flashlight to check out. Turns out a coconut has fallen and it nearby fallen besides him. Unknowing to him, a big coconut crab climbs down behind him. He turns around and was surprise. He then realize its a crab and gets fascinated by it. The crab then immediately goes down and eat the opened coconut. Kyle take the picture and send it to the Rangers. Back at the base, Katie is showing Leo of the new night vision feature she has on her tablet. Katie points her tablet elsewhere and they see 2 white dots running towards them from the garden forest, ultimately reveals it to be Hero. Leo pets Hero before receiving a call from Kyle. Kyle explain on the crab he discovers, currently towering over a coconut at the moment. Katie analyses the picture and learn its a Coconut Crab. After learning of the animal, Leo has a safety concern for the beach-goers and suggest they go there to put signs on the beach. The Ranger equip their gear and ride PlatypusOne to meet up with Kyle. At the beach, the Rangers sees Kyle observing the coconut crab. They have a discussion on how to making the wooden sign.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: In the yard, Simon is showing a snail to his friends. But Ferdinand says he’s got way better to show, he’s got a squirrel in his yard! Simon is bummed and decides to up the ante: well guess what, he’s got a dragon in his yard! And he suggests they all come back that evening to see it, (that will give him time to dress Gaspard up as a dragon.) But even though everyone quickly sees it’s a hoax, they all flip out big time when Dad appears at the back of the yard, disguised as…a dragon of course!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night, Berry and Dolly saw a shiny thing falling from the sky. Fearfully, they head to the depths of the forest to find out what the strange light might be. They found a star-shaped house and a girl.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One day Berry and Flutter played a board game. The first round was won by Berry, and the second one was won by him as well. In the third round, Flutter finished first. Berry got very angry. They played another round, but Flutter won again. Berry couldn’t help but made a scene.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Stanley and Balthazar ruin Flutters playing cards, but seeing the butterfly girls sadness, they ask Dollys help to make a brand new card deck.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Leapy the grasshopper makes fun of Katie the yellow ladybird, because she blows bigger bubbles than her. Later, regretting her actions, Leapy has to find a way to apologize to Katie.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Dolly accidentally knocks over a glass of water on Berrys painting. The colors on Berrys painting get faint and watery. Berry gets mad at Dolly for ruining his painting. Later Berrys friends admire the little snails unique style of painting, so he insists that it was his idea to make the painting like this. But then Dolly arrives and sheds light to Berrys lies.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Dolly leaves for and adventure with Harry Hedgehog, so she asks Bubbles to take care of her flowers while shes gone. Bubble forgets to water them, so they quickly wither. Now Bubble has to find a way to make the flowers bloom again.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The residents of the forest decide to celebrate the last day of the year with music. The ants form a choir, Dr Owl becomes the conductor, and all the little bugs create instruments for themselves. But Iris, the icebeetle loses her bells, so everyone starts to help her find them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are finally ready to leave for their picnic just as it starts to rain.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula invent a noisy game with a helium balloon they find stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco discovers Bing’s dressing up box so they both dress up. Coco is Princess Cococapono and Bing is, of course, King Bing. But there is only one crown and both need it to complete their outfits. When the crown gets broken Flop helps them to make new crowns out of the broken pieces.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing makes Sula a picture with all her favourite things on it. It just needs one last jewel stuck on but oops the glue spills all over the picture. Sparkles save the day.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: It’s time for spring-cleaning and Tilda decides to give her friends all the things that she doesn’t need any more and brings them in her garden. But her friends now think she’s moving out.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly’s wool that she just bought disappeared! She’s sure that it must have been stolen, so Tilda and Rupert found the Appleseed Detective Agency. Are the friends going to catch the burglar?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert finds out that Molly has a beautiful singing voice and asks her if she can sing a song for Tildas birthday. Molly absolutely wants to do this but can she overcome her stage fright?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Summer is at its hottest and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse want to run and play but the sun is just too hot and strong. That’s until Little Grey Squirrel gives them both a wonderful present, big leafy parasols. When he later changes his mind and takes Little Nutbrown Hare’s parasol back, the little hare is naturally disappointed. Can the friends find a way for all of them to be happy?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden rescues a loose kite from the Caribbean Sea, only to discover a parrotfish entangled in it. Meanwhile, Leo and Katie unveil a remote controlled ball for Hero who is not a fan of it. Jayden calls them to ask about the rescued parrotfish, prompting research on the computer. After learning about its habitat, they decide to return it to the coral reef. As they prepare to dive, they spot a reef shark to their dismay. Katie gets an idea to divert it with Heros ball which turns out to be a success. With Jayden in charge of the ball to keep the shark distracted, Leo and Katie dive underwater with the parrotfish. Suddenly, they see another shark fin but it turns out it’s Ranger Rocky and they inquire if its safe for them to release the parrotfish with a shark around. After learning about the parrotfishs defense mechanism, they decide that the parrotfish should be alright on its own.They successfully release the parrotfish but suddenly, the shark makes its way to PlatypusOne; however, the rangers get out of the water just in time. Back at the Garden, Katie is disappointed over the broken ball but Hero apparently likes it better as a normal, passive ball.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the African grasslands, Jane and Zumi engage in a friendly race that takes a turn for the worse when Zumi is bitten by a Puff Adder. Distressed, Jane calls for help, prompting Leo, Katie, and Hero to rush to the scene. Upon arrival, they find Zumi weakened by the snakebite, and Katie administers antivenom to aid her recovery. Leo and Hero embark on a suspenseful search for the Puff Adder, leading to a heart-stopping encounter. With Ranger Rockys timely intervention, the Puff Adder retreats into the grass, ensuring everyones safety. Recognizing the snake-infested environment, Katie identifies a snake-free zone in the desert for everyone’s safety. Ranger Rocky stays with Jane and Zumi for added protection, while Leo, Katie, and Hero bid them farewell. Back in the treehouse, the mission concludes with Leo hanging up a picture of the Puff Adder and a comical sock search initiated by Katie and Hero, ultimately earning praise from Ranger Rocky and a surprise appearance of the missing sock.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are super excited about going running in the woods! But they must wait for Fanni to wake up from her nap before heading out… When the nap drags on, the parents suggest they take Fanni to the forest in her stroller so that she can continue to sleep. However, this means everyone must remain silent during the excursion so as not to wake the baby: Shhhhhh!... Luckily, it ends up being a great opportunity to discover all the amazing sounds the forest has to offer!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina is sure that her dog Loupiote is the fastest animal around! But T’choupi believes Brocoli the goat can move even faster! Nina rises to the challenge, and before you know it, Loupiote and Brocoli are unknowingly competing with each other in a race! But the dog and goat do whatever they please. And when Ciboulette the cat gets involved, it’s all downhill from there!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi loves eating Fred’s goat’s cheese… but thinks again after getting a whiff of the goats’ pen: Ew!... So he’s very happy when Nina suggests they clean it out! Once they’re done with the cleaning, the two friends decide they could also make it more cozy. But shhh, not a word to anyone: it’s a surprise! However, after making the pen all spic and span and super comfortable, they’re shocked to find that the smell is still there!?! Thinking he’s found the perfect solution, Tchoupi sprays Mom’s perfume inside the pen… But what do the goats’ think of this new scent inside their house…?

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: There is a big surprise planned for the children today! A very big surprise: a pony named Apache! The children are being given an introduction to horse and pony riding. Charley is a bit frightened in the beginning… But Jane, who knows Apache really well, will help him overcome his fears. And Charley will then have a wonderful time!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia discover in their secret hideout an old comforter that probably belonged once to a child from the Mouse Mansion. Who, among the inhabitants, loose this cuddly toy in his childhood?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has a toothache. His daddy goes to get Dr. Bobola, but Dan, his older brother, thinks the doctor is going to pull his tooth! To avoid this, Julia tries to takes care of Sam instead of the doctor.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day while repairing an embankment, Marion strikes something hard and insists it must be the mast of a Viking Ship. It looks like a water pipe to Thomas but Marion is adamant that it isn’t. But the next day Thomas notices flooding near the bank and then there is a landslip and Marion has to admit her mistake and help prevent an accident.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Percy misses his friend Gator and keeps thinking back to the times they had together. It’s making him sad, so the other engines advise him to keep himself busy to take his mind off it. So Percy rushes about trying to keep busy, and ends up losing control of some trucks which roll into an old mine. Percy is frightened to go in after them, until he remembers Gator again and what Gator taught him about being brave!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to the lake to celebrate the Fourth of July.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to the theme part and rides his first rollercoaster!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and the gang race all over Busytown trying to find the lock that fits and old key they found. They search everywhere from the Busytown Museum to Mr Gronkle’s antiques. They come up empty until they remember that an old roll top desk was being delivered to the antique store near where they found the key and had a lock on it. They try the key and it fits. / Chocolate sauce on Lowlys car leaves Huckle and the gang puzzled.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is giving a sportscaster-like monologue as he kicks coconuts thru his makeshift goal... Parrot suggests that monkey should make a goal net... Mole then appears and tells them about spiders renowned webbing. When they find spider they are amazed by her webbing and invite her to a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy wants to be the fastest delivery person ever! Her dad upgrades her scooter, and she speeds through her deliveries… until she hits a bump, loses her brakes, and needs to be rescued before she gets to the cliffs!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Tom Thomas tries to help the Pioneers earn their bird watching badges using a fancy new APP, his phone obsession causes him to tumble over a cliff! Without Tom to fly the helicopter, it’s up to a mysterious new character to save the day…

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin worries that he’s not growing up fast enough when he embarks on a mission to help Fox find his lost missing baby tooth. Only when he realizes that growing up is not always what you see on the outside, does he stop comparing himself and start trusting that he is growing up in other ways. /Franklin learns the importance of patience and practice when he and Goose decide to head out on their own to become overnight Dynaroo Karate masters, instead of joining Aunt T and the other kids in Karate club lessons.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy tried to take some honey from the bees and they chased him. He got such a fright that he no longer wants to leave the burrow. His brothers and sister will do everything they can to help him over his phobia.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Accusing a mysterious thief of stealing his candy, Sketcky ends up finding it at the bottom of his toy chest. Doodleboo meets a Riddleboo to ward off thieves.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Attention, ladies and gentlemen, the circus has just arrived near Doodleboos house. You too, guess what Doodleboo prefers at the circus.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky and Bubble learn a choreography together, but Sketcky does not know how to do somersaults. Doodleboo knows someone who could teach him how to do it.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty’s hat gives Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave a magic Hatty-hat each to wear and then runs off to have fun in Hat Land with all the Hatty-hats from their previous adventures. For the first time ever, Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave take turns in asking questions and a hat-less Hatty takes their place in the Game Time line-up! Each question takes them closer to reuniting Hatty with his favourite hat - and Hatty discovers it’s much harder answering questions than asking them!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty helps Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave pack up their Rollypods for a vacation at the seaside. There are so many things they want to take, but which items do they need for the perfect beach holiday and which items can be left behind? The sing a song to help them remember everything they’ve packed and check it all back on board for the journey home, so that nothing is left behind!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The friends are all playing together in the Autumn meadow. Little Redwood Fox inadvertently spoils all the games of the day, but the others put their heads together and come up with a game that suits her perfectly.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s a fine Autumn day and it seems that all of the meadow creatures are out enjoying the sun. Little Nutbrown Hare is surprised that Big Nutbrown Hare knows every single creature in the meadow. He sets out to trick him into believing there is a brand new animal… called a ‘Grrr-umph’, which he cleverly creates out of shadows! Will Big Nutbrown Hare be tricked?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that everyone else can whistle but him… the birds, Little Grey Squirrel, Otter and even the wind in the river reeds. Inspired by the wind, he practices really hard and eventually learns to blow through a reed himself to make it whistle. He and his friends make a beautiful and eerie whistling symphony amongst the reeds.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is vooshing with Hoppity around the garden, making him fly higher and higher. With one particularly enthusiastic throw Hoppity disappears. After a hunt, Bing finds Hoppity in the washing up bowl and gets upset because a wet, mucky Hoppity just doesn’t feel right.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has enough money to buy one thing in Padgets shop but he finds it hard to choose between all the lovely things. After much deliberation Bing chooses a campervan but on the way home he begins to regret his decision.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its bedtime but wheres Hoppity? Bing remembers playing with him in the garden so Flop finds a torch and together they set off in the dark for an adventure.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: There are two balls in the kindergarden. One, the big bugs play with, and one for the small bugs. One day one of the balls bursts and they all have to find a way to peacfully play with the one remaining ball. Soon they realize that they can also play together, so Stanley admits that the small bugs are not that clumsy after all.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Moonbug cant walk. The centipede always helps him to get him to where he wants to go. But one day the centipede has to go on a long journey, so the Moonbug is left to go alone to Alfonsos concert. But Eddy, the potatobeetle builds a special chair with wheels for Moonbug. The Moonbug can finally go alone to Alfonsos concert, and anywhere he wants to.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: A great storm tears down the fireflies house. The whole house breaks into peaces and all the lanterns with it. So the small firefiles go on a journey to find the wise old Shining Bug, and ask him to give them new lanterns. programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe

But it turns out the group always makes fun of Flutters real friends. So Flutter decides to choose her peacful way of life besides her friends.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Mr Frumble’s morning newspaper disappears off his front step, Huckle sets out to investigate what happened to it. After a number of other innocuous items ‘disappear’ from across town, Huckle ultimately discovers that the culprits are none other than Pig Will and Pig Won’t. They are enthusiastically taking part in Busytown’s Annual Recycling Drive by picking up anything they see that can be recycled./Huckle, Lowly and Sally happen upon a huge tooth and can’t imagine anyone in all of Busytown big enough to own it.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey decides to go and learn collecting and storing skills from the chipmunk...When meet Chipmunk in the forest, Monkey the secret to a a good storage place, and Chipmunks learns what it means to have a friend. When they return Monkey stores his leafs up on a tree, but once he touches the tree the entire collection drops from the canopy and covers monkey and parrot….

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman tries to finish his Sea Life Spotting project but ends up stranded in a cave by rising tides. Sam pilots Juno to rescue him just in time.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Norman and new boy Peter get lost at sea, Krystyna must pilot the new rescue plane and save them before their ship sinks!

programme.title: Kipper

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig is very proud of his new purple woolly sweater and shows it off to Kipper. Arnold spots a big red arrow, and then another, and they follow them into the woods. Pig doesn’t notice he has caught his sweater on a branch. The arrows were Tiger’s idea and he laughs at them from a tree he’s hiding in. Then he realises they’re lost. The unravelled wool from Pig’s sweater leads them back home.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out on a picnic with T’choupi and his family, plus Nina, Dad chances upon a four-leaf clover! He gifts it to Fanni as a lucky charm. As a result, convinced that he’s having a bad day, T’choupi is now determined to find a four-leaf clover of his own, to turn the tide and enjoy nothing but good fortune for the rest of the day!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: The parents are hoping Fanni will take her afternoon nap, but she’s still wide awake, playing with her animal sounds toy… Until it stops working… Oh dear! T’choupi quickly steps in and improvises animal sounds. But when he quickly loses interest, Mom comes up with an idea: they should go and find the nearby animals and listen to their cries, straight from the "horse’s" mouth! With a bit of luck, this pleasant expedition will tire Fanni out enough to send her to sleep…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: To participate at the annual cheese hunt with the other children of the residence, Julia faces a problem : she has a cold and cant sniff anything. Sam is going to help her to play with them anyway!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. programme.title: Tilda Appleseed

But Tilda is sad at the thought of all the nice things her best friend will miss while hes asleep. With the promise that she will cook for him, she persuades Rupert to stay awake and spend the winter at her place.

programme.title: The Triplets

Mom is starting to find her kids quite capricious, so she tells them the incredible story of a boy whose parents gave him every single thing he asked for.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets and Kiko decide to have a funny-face contest, but Grandpa warns them: if the wind blows in your direction your face might get stuck that way your whole life. The Kids are totally panicked and want to find out if it is true. Poet and Turbulent make Kiko believe that his face got stuck but then Grandpa plays the same trick on them. Poet and Turbulent sheepishly hide behind lampshades. Good thing it was only a joke!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie has the habit of keeping everything they find, which annoys her brothers. Then the boys find an object that Rosie lost and do not want to return it, using her favourite principle of finders, keepers.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Imagination Adventure: Secret Agents Sarah and Caillou try and steal a diamond from Rosies secret villain lair.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Its the hottest day of the year on Sodor and the sun is causing the tracks to buckle and bend. Dowager Hatt, arrives with a present for the Fat Controller - a white pith helmet to protect him from the sun explaining that white reflects heat. Meanwhile the buckled tracks cause Whiff to lose some rubbish from his trucks and a dropped bottle causes a fire. When Belle and Flynn come to the rescue, Belle is derailed and Flynn must travel on his road wheels to put out the fire. The buckled tracks are finally repaired and Thomas suggests that they paint the new tracks white (like Sir Tophams hat) which will reflect the sun and hopefully stop the tracks buckling again.

Once they’re done with the cleaning, the two friends decide they could also make it more cozy. But shhh, not a word to anyone: it’s a surprise! However, after making the pen all spic and span and super comfortable, they’re shocked to find that the smell is still there!?! programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah was driving her dirt bike in the Philippine forest, admiring the view while doing trick before experiencing an earthquake. She then wants to investigate in hopes to save an animal that may be injured. Back in the garden, Leo is relaxing in the shade of a tree, looking up clouds. Katie then appear with her tablet and inform of an earthquake in the Philippine, and the Junior Rangers worried since Farah was on patrol there. Farah then calls up Leo and informs him of an animal she discover. After the Junior Rangers learn more about the animal with Katies computer, they agree to meet up with Farah there. Leo, Katie and Farah sees that the Philippine Eaglet is watching them from afar, and Farah warns them to not be close. The Eaglet then approaches Hero hungrily, which Hero flies in the air with its jetpack. The Junior Rangers sees that the Eaglet may not know how to fly and they decided to teach it how. Their attempt didnt work out and they later meet up with Ranger Rocky. They explain their situation, causing him to call up Ranger Joey for more information.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, invites Bubble, Berry, and Dolly for a visit. They make ice cream and play together. Bubble admits to cheating in the game. Because of this, the little friends come up with a new game where everyone can win."

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest gather on the hilltop to watch the evening meteor shower. Stanley and Balthazar want to build a seesaw but constantly encounter obstacles. The meteor shower mesmerizes them, then they bid farewell to each other, and everyone starts heading home. The Firefly falls asleep contentedly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is building a tower of blocks when Coco takes some to make a rainbow. When Charlie wants to play with the blocks too, they decide to make a new game they can all play.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

Bing, on the other hand, throws all the food into the water at once – not thinking that a big quacking goose will come along and eat it all in one bite!

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Ella never had the golden ball that the baker hides every year in a cheese puff and that is supposed to bring luck. Ella thinks it should be her turn. Except that Julia has never had it either...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The feather of a rare bird brought back from Julias island escapes from her own hands and flies towards the stairwell. A chase begins in the various air currents, involving Sam and Julia.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Its Grandfathers birthday! The Triplets want to give him an amazing present, Girl wants to offer him a rake for his garden, Poet a big hat and Turbulent wants to bought a race car. Unfortunately and despite their willingness, the Triplets dont have enough money! On Mommys good advice, they decide to team up to buy Grandfather the most amazing gift. Their choice goes for a beautiful tie which they buy and wrap up. Everything is ready for Grandfathers birthday, but thats without counting on Totos appetite.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: At dinnertime, Mommy announces to the Triplets there is a new neighbor in the building. She asks them to go welcoming her and invite her for coffee. However, Madam Gzell, the neighbor, is absolutely not a nice person. She welcomes the Triplets really harshly, all she worries about is her sick baby. When they learn there is a new baby in the building, all the Triplets want, its to play with him. But Madam Gzell is really mysterious, no one can see her "baby"! The investigation is on !

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: The chuggers are making preparations for the Winter Parade through Chuggington. Special glowing coloured lights are fitted to the trains taking part in the magical procession. Disaster strikes when freezing fog traps Koko, who is collecting the Mayor. Wilson bravely goes out on a rescue mission and locates them, despite not being able to see them. He cleverly realises that to avoid the fog, they must go through the mountain - not down it.
